intro: Leucocoma canadensis, commonly known as the Canada moonflower, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its white, fragrant flowers that open at night. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a smooth texture. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, dry seeds.
